WRITING.TEXT: I have followed SS for a long time and when I saw this last night, I cried. It made me so happy. I actually messaged them about her while she was in the shelter cause I came across her listing and they rescued her. They are seriously some of the most amazing and selfless individuals ever.

As long as people wash their hands properly (especially healthcare workers and caretakers) and dispose of anything contaminated by an infected person(s) correctly, all will be fine. You can sit right next to someone infected with Ebola and not catch it, if that tells you anything.

WRITING.TITLE: Question about gifts...
WRITING.TEXT: Hello again everyone, First off, I wanted to thank everyone so much for the support in my last post. It really did help me out and I thank you from the bottom of my heart. As for the situation at the moment, my cousin is rapidly deteriorating and the fluid buildup in her stomach and chest is happening more quickly, they drained 9 liters off her stomach yesterday. She said the clinical trials the doctors want her in won't start for another month and I think she's scared to wait that long. Last night she flat out told me "I'm dying of cancer. It's only a matter of time and it sucks." My heart is breaking and sometimes I can't find the right words to say, I just want to hug her and take her pain away. I will be going to visit her next week and I wanted to bring her some gifts or something, but for some reason I can't figure out what to bring. My question is, what kinds of things might be best? I wasn't sure about food items as she's still on chemo, tons of pain killers, and the fluid buildup kills her appetite. I just wondered what kind of stuff anyone who has ever gone through cancer or treatment for cancer most appreciated receiving. Thank you for reading, all your advice is greatly appreciated.

Thanks for the advice :) As of today, she's starting to come out of it I think. She's actually laying right next to her sister on my moms bed right now and hasn't been hissing as much, she's letting us pet her, and she's kind of playing. So I'm hoping its over with. I have just never seen her act like that and it was awful, she acted like a feral cat. But thank you for your advice and if she starts acting up again I'll definitely do what you suggested :)

WRITING.TITLE: Can anyone help me figure out what's wrong with my cat?
WRITING.TEXT: If this is not allowed, please delete and I apologize. I just figured this is probably the best place to ask this. I've had two cats that are sisters for five years now. They are both spayed, completely indoor cats (never stepped foot outside, they're too scared), and out of the five years we've had them they have both been the most friendly and lovely cats ever. They got along so great, never any issues with either of them. Well, Monday night our friend stayed the night and brought his five month old kitten, as he was giving it to a friend whom could give it a better home the next morning. It was a male and my cats have never been around other cats. They were upset, hissing and hiding, and I finally put it in its carrier to sleep for the night. My friend left with it the next morning, so all was said and done. So the next day, my cat Lucy is still upset. Hissing and growling at everyone that comes within five feet of her, especially her sister. Its now two days later and she's still hiding, hissing and growling, and her entire demeanor is a polar opposite. I mean, this cat was such a big baby. Followed you around, was very happily vocal, ran and played constantly, and now its like she's feral. She is eating, drinking, and using the litter box though, so I'm hoping its nothing health wise going on. But I was just wondering if anyone had any insight or advice for a situation like this, I was going to call my vet tomorrow but I'm not sure how helpful they'll be. I really really do not want to get rid of her or put her outside, but I cannot have her attacking my other cat, my dog, or my mom. She's beginning to lunge at us now. Thank you so very much for reading, I'm at such a loss and love my kitty dearly but I have no idea what to do.

It can happen from not eating for extended periods of time, then eating or overindulging. Its a shock to your system. You should probably talk to your doctor and psychiatrist, as continuing this pattern of eating can do long lasting damage to your body. I know from experience. I hope you feel better.

I have a binge eating disorder and do this constantly. Sipping on water, ginger ale, or sprite kinda helps. Peppermint gum or candies also help, along with Pepto or emetrol (the OTC anti-nausea liquid). Just try to relax, don't lay down too soon so you don't get heartburn or indigestion. Usually it just takes patience to let it digest and for the feelings to go away. I hope you feel better soon!

My mom has had sarcoidosis for over 15 years now and it was hell getting her diagnosed. Her x-ray showed the butterfly shape that shows up in sarcoid patients, it just took a good doctor to finally put two and two together. But steroids do her wonders. Best of luck OP, I hope they get it figured out. Sarcoidosis is worth looking into.

It's just really surprising that in this day and age someone hasn't found it. From what I've read it was online ages ago but I guess her family took some sort of legal action that prevented it from ever being seen again or from anyone getting their hands on it. I imagine its pretty much the exact same as the Budd Dwyer video but, thought I'd ask.

WRITING.TITLE: Christine Chubbuck on air suicide?
WRITING.TEXT: Has anyone ever come across the video? She was a 29 year old news reporter in Florida, and she committed suicide by gun on a live news broadcast on July 15th, 1979. I was just curious if anyone had ever actually come across the video of it. Edit: spelling.
I have hyperthyroidism and thats exactly what I experience. Get your levels checked again. My GP put me on a beta-blocker and it has helped immensely :)

Thank you so much :) That is so great about your aunt, you guys are so very lucky. I hope she continues to feel good and maybe one day find something that kicks her cancers ass for good :) My cousin actually got the results of her pet-scan and it's contained in the pleura around her lungs, stomach, and intestines right now but has not spread to any other organs. I was so happy to hear that! I know once it usually starts spreading it can happen pretty fast so hearing that was kind of a relief. We know not to count our chickens before they hatch but there's nothing wrong with trying to stay optimistic :)

WRITING.TITLE: Antibiotics and probiotics.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello everyone, I had a quick question regarding the use of probiotics while taking antibiotics. I was prescribed Clindamycin for an infected tooth and gum yesterday, but was warned about the possible severe diarrhea, colitis, and c-diff complications. I know that with any antibiotic comes the risk of diarrhea but I guess this one can be a doozy. So when I picked it up from my pharmacy, my pharmacist pulled me aside to talk to me about it because of my history with IBS-D. He suggested that since I'm lactose intolerant and cannot eat yogurt or anything, that I take this Floragen Acidophilus probiotic. It has 20 billion live cultures per capsule and he said it is what most people recommended and take. I've never even taken a probiotic before but I know some are prone to causing diarrhea when you first start them. My question is has anyone tried this probiotic or taken probiotics while on a strong antibiotic? Or should these probiotics really help while I'm taking them? I'm terrified to start this antibiotic cause I have a history of being hospitalized due to severe diarrhea, but I can't risk this infection getting worse or spreading. Thank you for any advice or input!
I'm glad its starting to go away :) Just remember next time that its usually anxiety thats making it worse. I always have to tell myself I'm the one who's in control.

Sometimes having having something light on your stomach does help :) As terrifying and hard as it is to even eat a bite of a cracker sometimes. Night time is when my anxiety sets in and for the same reasons. But Netflix and Reddit usually keep me pretty distracted until I can fall asleep :)

Hey I'm sorry you're having a rough time, its night time here but I'm not sure about you. First off, try to just walk around a little and take a few deep breaths. Try your hardest to relax a little. Maybe sipping some water would help. Anxiety is the worst, and I'm sure thats probably the most of what you're feeling right now. If you're stomach is really upset, try some 7up, ginger ale, Pepto, an anti-emetic if you have one at your disposal and see if that helps. Just keeping yourself distracted helps a ton. I hope you get to feeling better soon :)
This made my day. You guys are awesome.
Get your thyroid tested.
These taste like ass. It was almost like eating the powder straight out of a kool-aid packet.
I have them too! I thought I was alone, haha. My heating pad is my best friend.
I once ate a moldy cookie (unknowingly) and was completely fine :) Of course I freaked out for a while, but nothing happened.

Thank you so much :) We're all planning a get together and we're gonna do something special. I guess she has an appointment with the head of an oncology team that specializes in breast cancer at the Cleveland Clinic. They want to try genome therapy. I've never read much into genome therapy but I'm gonna do some research.
Possibly get tested for Lyme disease. Even if you don't recall any tick or bug bites.

That is so awesome! I'm starting out at 15mg for a week or so then going up to 30mg, as I'm kind of sensitive to medications so I ease into anything new. But your comment made me feel even more at ease about it! How have I not heard of this drug yet?! Haha! I'm gonna keep my fingers crossed that it works as well as I've heard! Thank you!

I actually have this problem too :( Even if its someone I haven't been around in days, months, or even years. I have to calm myself down and just think logically and remember how you even catch it in the first place, so if I haven't even been around them, how in the world am I gonna catch what they have? But I agree with /u/empireofnor, just unfollow that person so their posts wont show up in your newsfeed. It isn't like unfriending them or anything :) Also, when I'm constipated, it makes me super crampy and just makes me feel yucky in general. Don't let your mind get the best of you, you're gonna be fine :)

Thank you for taking time out to reply to me. I believe they are getting everything in order, and I'm sure hospice care will be happening soon enough. We just don't want to see her in pain anymore, but we're not ready for her to go. I think she is coming to terms with reality, it'll just be waiting for everyone else to also do that. Thank you so much, I appreciate it.

WRITING.TITLE: Loved one was told today she's stage 4
WRITING.TEXT: And that she is also incurable at this point. This is her second run with Triple Negative breast cancer, and it started out this time with a mass behind her sternum. It has now spread to the pleura around her intestines and elsewhere. They will continue chemo to try and fight it as long as possible, along with some other types of drugs and possibly clinical trials at the Mayo Clinic. She didn't want to know how long she has left but was told she has a 22% chance of survival at this point. I grew up without my family and just a couple years ago, they came back into my life. My cousin has been such a great friend, listener, supporter, and she's just all around fantastic. I love her so dearly and I'm so heartbroken over this. She is not giving up the fight, but is finding it hard to not lose hope. I was the very first out of the family to receive this news, so now I'm waiting for everyone else to find out. Has anyone else ever dealt with, either themselves or a loved one or family member, stage four triple negative breast cancer? Even with the drugs and chemo, how fast does it grow? I'm just looking for insight ir advice to better prepare for what's coming and to be there for my cousin, well, my entire family is by her side. But any advice, information, or insight is greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for reading.

Hey, its not your fault. Don't beat yourself down like that, you didn't ask to have emetophobia, it happened. Take a deep breath and try to just relax for a bit. I've been in your situation so many times, and the only reason I ever feel sick is because of my anxiety. When I have an attack like that, I'm hyper aware of my body, looking and waiting for any little symptom to pop up and feed my fear. You're probably just sore from the day itself and getting anxious doesn't help, unfortunately. Just try to distract yourself for a while or try to sleep. You made a huge step, be proud of that! :) Its going to take times like these to get to where you want to be with your phobia. Just roll with the punches :) If everyone else is feeling fine, I honestly wouldn't worry. Plus, in my experience at least, once food poisoning hits, it REALLY hits and you'll most def know you've got food poisoning. Nachos are kinda heavy and greasy anyways and always kind of sit heavy on my stomach, but have never made me v*. I really hope you feel better and don't let this discourage you! Keep taking these steps, they're gonna make a world of difference :) You've totally got this.
To be honest, I just use Clorox disinfecting wipes on it. I have for a couple years now and it's never done damage to any of my phones.
This movie was pretty awesome.

It's definitely a trigger for us emetophobes, and we can't help it. I know my mind and thoughts get the best of me sometimes too. I also sanitize my phone and thoroughly wash my hands after getting home, I ask my fiance to do the same and thankfully he doesn't get annoyed and is now making it a habit. He just looks at it as one of my little quirks :)

That is definitely not a nice conversation piece, especially at a freaking party. You probably weren't the only one bothered by it, I'm sure no one wants to hear the details of that crap then share the chip bowl with him.

I honestly cannot stand people who are either sick, catching something, or just getting over something who show up to peoples house or parties. Granted, if they're getting over it, its highly unlikely they're contagious, but still. If he's at least eating and out of the house (at a party nonetheless) then he shouldn't be contagious or even carrying germs. Unless he's actively been sick right before coming there or at the party, cause remember how you catch these things - coming in contact with or ingesting v* or feces particles. Its highly unlikely he's spreading either of those two things there. Just try to remember logically how you could catch it and try to get your mind off of it and enjoy the party. Just avoid him if its bothering you that bad and just wash your hands, and even ask your boyfriend if he could please wash his hands, as you're this worried. I truly feel you though, I hate when I'm in a situation like this but I just try to use the knowledge I have about it and try to have a good time :)

I've had a pretty bad sinus infection for weeks now, and I think it's finally made its way into my chest so I'm feeling the same way you are. I see my GP tomorrow so hopefully I can get over this crap, it sucks :( I let mine go too long, I think. Try some decongestants or something for sinuses over the counter, they usually help a little. I hope you feel better soon! :)
What is the Camera man?
Here's my next question (god I probably sound like an idiot to all of you) but how do I know I'm getting what I asked for? How do I know its Indica or Sativa and not a hybrid or something?
I figured it would be a course of trial and error, but I'll definitely look into the Sativa strain. Thank you!
Unfortunately I live in Ohio, haha.

Thank you! The last couple times I smoked I felt horrible, like dizzy, nauseous, and just generally way too f***ed up. So I'm weary of trying it again unless I know what it is. Im just not sure what my best choices are, but I will definitely download that app :)

WRITING.TITLE: I figured you guys might be able to help.
WRITING.TEXT: I hope this is the right place for this question. If not, I apologize. So, long story short, I suffer from chronic pain, gastro problems, anxiety, and manic depression. I hate taking pills, they make me feel even worse, so I figured maybe cannabis is the way to go at this point. My question to all of you is - is there a certain type I should try? I know there's so many different strains and I used to just smoke whatever my fiance had, but its been years. I'm not looking to just get ripped, I want something that just straight up helps the pain, nausea, anxiety, etc. Any advice or insight is much appreciated!
As much as it sucks, having something in your tummy does help :) Ginger ale is a lifesaver lol

In my experience, upping the dosage of any medication can make you feel funny or upset your tummy for a while. Its hit and miss with some people, though. Just try eating a little something before you take it and drinking plenty of water. Then after a while if your tummy seems kinda upset again, try eating something small and light, like a piece of toast or something :) I hope it passes and you get yourself adjusted.
His temp was 98.9 :) And so far, he feels okay after eating. Thanks for the reassurance! It really does help :)
